channel.title: Andrew's Blog on Andrew
channel.description: Recent content in Andrew's Blog on Andrew

item.title: The Making of Star Trek: The Next Generation's Greatest Episode, 'The Inner Light'
item.description: — Morgan Gendel, writer of ‘The Inner Light’: I’m amazed they let me do this episode as I ended up writing it, because it’s so unbelievably, heartbreakingly sad,” Gendel said.

item.title: Roger Ebert on Lost in Translation
item.description: — Roger Ebert: They share something as personal as their feelings rather than something as generic as their genitals.

item.title: Whatever happened to the great debates?
item.description: — Scott Feschuk, writing for Maclean’s: Now we’ve got nutjobs galore deciding not to vaccinate their kids based on advice from such medical experts as the guy whose brother knows a lady whose yoga instructor’s barista got vaccinated—and now she’s allergic to artisanal honey and hugs.

item.title: I’m an Anti-Braker
item.description: A few weeks ago I saw a car accident - two people went through an intersection at the same time.

item.title: Sam and Suzy's excellent adventure
item.description: — Roger Ebert, reviewing Moonrise Kingdom: [Bill] Murray is always right for a role in an Anderson film, and I wonder if it’s because they share a bemused sadness.

item.title: Roger Ebert on James Bond
item.description: — Roger Ebert, reviewing The Living Daylights: The correct tone for the Bond films was established right at the start, with Sean Connery’s quizzical eyebrows and sardonic smile.

item.title: The World's End
item.description: — Matt Zoller Seitz - Reviewing The World’s End: But in an era in which mainstream movies not only lack rhythm but seem to have forgotten how to dance, this one’s briskness is inspiring.

item.title: Barbecue Meat Palace
item.description: As it would turn out, there is not a single restaurant in the world called Barbecue Meat Palace.

item.title: Unique
item.description: Did you know, this is the only place on the googlable internet that contains “Big fellas with tiny feet throwing pizzas like frisbees nude”?

item.title: Health Canada Misses the Point
item.description: — Neurologica: It is not the job of a health organization to respect diversity of opinion, but rather to respect the scientific evidence in order to do their job – protecting the public health.

item.title: Homeopathy Awareness Week
item.description: — NeuroLogica: For homeopaths, the only purpose of clinical research is to validate what they already “know” – it is a statistical crap shoot of placebo vs placebo.

item.title: “Integrative medicine”: A brand, not a specialty
item.description: — Science-Based Medicine: There is no such thing as “alternative” medicine.
